lcObjectivesGroup.lcObjective: Identify the core elements found in a step.
Add a <steps> element to the task
Add <step> elements to the <steps>, using <cmd> and <info> to provide additional information.

lcInstruction.p: The core part of a task is the set of steps that the user is to perform.
In DITA task topics, the procedure the reader is to perform is contained in a <steps> element; the individual steps in that procedure are contained in <step> elements.

When output is generated from the task topic, the steps usually take the form of a numbered list. The actual text that is used to identify each step (whether it’s simply the number and some punctuation, or the word “Step” followed by a number) is up to the transform implementation. When you're authoring a step, most DITA editors will display step numbers beside each step.
DITA also allows you to create an unordered list for the steps, with the <steps-unordered> element. For more information about this element, see the DITA Specification.
